p: The in vitro alpha amylase and alpha glucosidase inhibitory activities of vindoline were tested and compared to acarbose a standard drug. In Table 3, at a concentration of 0.375 mM, vindoline resulted in a weak alpha amylase activity of 28% whilst at the same concentration; acarbose showed significantly high enzyme inhibitory activity of approximately 80% at p < 0.05. In addition, vindoline recorded a significantly weak alpha glucosidase inhibitory activity of 11% when compared to acarbose, which showed a strong inhibitory activity (83%) at p < 0.05.
